Package io.crums.sldg.packs

Class RowPack

java.lang.Object
io.crums.sldg.packs.RecurseHashRowPack
io.crums.sldg.packs.RowPack
All Implemented Interfaces:
RowBag, io.crums.util.hash.Digest
Direct Known Subclasses:
CachingRowPack
public class RowPack
extends RecurseHashRowPack
Base RowBag implementation. Note this uses no caching/memo-ization. Consequently the cost every full-row lookup is linear in the row number. Not good: validating the pack then is 0(n2). See CachingRowPack.

Serial Format

Definitions

    HASH        := BYTE ^32
    RN          := LONG
    RHASH       := HASH   // hash of entire row (used as the value of a hash pointer)
    IHASH       := HASH   // input hash
                          // the hash of row is computed from IHASH RHASH^p with the RHASH's
                          // being the row's hash [skip] pointers

Structure

    
    I_COUNT     := INT                // number of rows with full info (have input hash)
    FULL_RNS    := RN ^ICOUNT         // full info row numbers in ascending order
    
    // The following is inferred from FULL_RNS
    // see Ledger.refOnlyCoverage(java.util.Collection)
    
    R_COUNT     := INT                // (INFERRED)
     
                              
    R_TBL       := RHASH ^R_COUNT     // hash pointer table
    I_TBL       := IHASH ^I_COUNT     // input hash table
    
    HASH_TBL    := R_TBL I_TBL
    
    ROW_BAG     := ICOUNT FULL_RNS HASH_TBL

  • Method Details

    • load

      public static RowPack load​(java.nio.ByteBuffer in) throws ByteFormatException
      Loads and returns a new instance by reading the given buffer. The content of the buffer argument should not be later modified: this is because to the degree feasible, the data is not actually copied. On return, the given in buffer is advanced by as many bytes as were read (err, sliced out).
      Throws:
      ByteFormatException - if an error or inconsistency in the data is discovered

    • refOnlyHash

      protected java.nio.ByteBuffer refOnlyHash​(long rowNumber)
      Description copied from class: RecurseHashRowPack
      Returns the ref-only row-hash from the minimal store, if found. A minimal bag does not redundantly contain row-hashes for rows for which their input-hashes are known: the row-hash of such rows can computed from the hash of the concatenation of the input hash with the row-hashes from lower numbered rows.
      Specified by:
      refOnlyHash in class RecurseHashRowPack
      Returns:

    • inputHash

      public java.nio.ByteBuffer inputHash​(long rowNumber)
      Description copied from interface: RowBag
      Returns the input hash for the row at the given number. The eligible input arguments are those by RowBag.getFullRowNumbers().
      Parameters:
      rowNumber - one of the full-row-numbers
      Returns:
      32-byte hash

    • getFullRowNumbers

      public java.util.List<java.lang.Long> getFullRowNumbers()
      Description copied from interface: RowBag
      Returns the row numbers for which full rows in this bag can be constructed.
      Returns:
      non-null, not empty, strictly ascending list of positive row numbers
      See Also:
      RowBag.getRow(long)
